subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... Found something interesting in the wikipedia. I still don t understand how it relates to interfaces, abstractions and operations like instanceof regarding
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:

>>>>> Interpretation cannot be avoided if you use interfaces,
>>>>> abstraction, and operations like instanceof.
>>>>
>>>> I'd think that C++ does provide the same features, doesn't it?
>>>> Would you say it's an interpreted language?
>>>
>>> Yes, to a degree. However, C++ deals with much of this at compile
>>> time.
>>
>> So are you saying that C++ interpretes at compile time??? Or that in
>> fact interpretation *can* be avoided?
>
> Please excuse the brief reply, but I have a project deadline to meet:
>
> Google on "template metaprogramming".

Found something interesting in the wikipedia. I still don't understand
how it relates to interfaces, abstractions and operations like
instanceof regarding compile- vs. Runtime, though.

Puzzled, Ilja
